citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Although the facility has a system in place for tracking drug expirations for removal, there are bottles of expired drugs
intermingled with unexpired drugs intended for use in animals: One bottle of furosemide (expired 04/2025) and one bottle
of isoxsuprine (expired 02/2025). The attending veterinarian removed these drugs when found during the inspection. The
use of expired medications is not considered to be a safe or appropriate method to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat
diseases and injuries because expired drugs may be ineffective or produce other undesired effects. Animals may
experience discomfort or distress due to unrelieved symptoms or unexpected side effects from the use of expired
medication. The program for providing adequate veterinary care shall include the use of appropriate methods to prevent,
control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries, which includes following established procedures to ensure expired
medications are removed and cannot be administered to animals.
TO BE CORRECTED BY 07/29/2025

A primary enclosure housing one adult great horned owl contains an unprotected electrical cord and an uncovered
electrical receptacle that are accessible to the bird. Unprotected cords and electrical receptacles pose an injury risk. The
licensee must ensure that all enclosures are constructed and maintained so that they protect the birds from injury.
TO BE CORRECTED BY 07/22/2025

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live birds.
citations.narrative:
The enclosures intended to transport birds are not marked with directional arrows and the words, "This Side Up" and “Live
Animals” as required.
Proper labeling of transport enclosures housing live animals helps to ensure that enclosures stay upright at all times for
the safety and comfort of the animals. The licensee must ensure that all transport enclosures are clearly marked with this
information on the top and on one or more sides, and the words "Live Animals" must be at least 1 inch high.
TO BE CORRECTED BY 07/29/2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
